Class PhysicsObject

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.Actor
      PhysicsObject

public class PhysicsObject
extends greenfoot.Actor

A PhysicsObject is an Actor that is equipped with some basic physical interactions. It has velocity and angular velocity, which control its movement and rotation.

Because Actor uses integer values for position and rotation, this class duplicates these fields as double values (decimals). The exact values can be found with the getPrecise... methods, such as getPreciseX().

Author:
William Chargin

increaseAngularVelocity

public void increaseAngularVelocity(double domega)
Increases this object's angular velocity by the given amount.

Parameters:
domega - the increase of angular velocity, in degrees/frame, where positive values indicate counterclockwise rotation (stands for Δω)

increaseVelocity

public void increaseVelocity(double dvx,
                             double dvy)
Increases the velocity by the given value on each axis. This is equivalent to calling: 
setVelocity(getVelocityX() + dvx, getVelocityY() + dvy);

Parameters:
dvx - the change in x-velocity (stands for Δvx)
dvy - the change in y-velocity (stands for Δvy)

increaseVelocityPolar

public void increaseVelocityPolar(double r,
                                  double theta)
Increases the velocity by the given magnitude in the given direction. You can think of this as "pushing" this object in a certain direction.

Parameters:
r - the magnitude (radius) of the increase of velocity
theta - the direction (angle) of the increase of velocity, in degrees, where zero is due east and positive values are counterclockwise

setAngularDamping

public void setAngularDamping(double angularDamping)
Sets the angular damping value. The angular velocity will be multiplied by this value after each frame.

See Also:
angularDamping

setAngularVelocity

public void setAngularVelocity(double omega)
Sets this object's angular velocity.

Parameters:
omega - the new angular velocity, in degrees/second, where positive values indicate counterclockwise rotation
See Also:
omega

setLinearDamping

public void setLinearDamping(double linearDamping)
Sets the linear damping value. The velocity will be multiplied by this value after each frame.

See Also:
linearDamping

setLocation

public void setLocation(double x,
                        double y)
Assigns a new location for this actor. The new coordinates will be rounded to the nearest integer and passed to Actor.setLocation(int,int).

Parameters:
x - the new x-location
y - the new y-location

setMaxAngularSpeed

public void setMaxAngularSpeed(double maxAngularSpeed)
Sets the maximum angular speed of this object.

Parameters:
maxAngularSpeed - the new maximum angular speed, or a negative value to indicate that there should not be any maximum angular speed

Sets the maximum speed of this object.

Parameters:
maxSpeed - the new maximum speed, or a negative value to indicate that there should not be any maximum speed
See Also:
maxSpeed

setRotation

public void setRotation(double theta)
Assigns a new rotation for this actor. The new rotation will be rounded to the nearest integer and passed to Actor.setRotation(int).

Parameters:
theta - the new rotation, in degrees, where zero is due east and positive values indicate counterclockwise rotation
